title: Barnwell picks five NFL teams set to decline: Who could miss the playoffs entirely?
content: Which teams will take a step back and lose more games this season? We made five picks based on troubling signs, offseason subtractions and more.

title: Agent unsure of Richardson's future with Colts
content: Anthony Richardson Sr.'s agent reacted with disappointment with the Colts' decision to name Daniel Jones the starting quarterback and said he's unsure of his client's future with the team.

title: Yanks make history with 2nd 9-HR game of season
content: After a lengthy rain delay, Giancarlo Stanton hit two home runs and the Yankees matched a franchise record with nine long balls Tuesday night in a convincing 13-3 victory over the Rays, an effort the slugger labeled as "awesome to see."

title: Saints QB competition to continue, Moore says
content: The Saints are taking their quarterback decision down to the wire, with coach Kellen Moore saying they want to continue the competition between Tyler Shough and Spencer Rattler through next week.

title: Texas QB Manning says future plans still unclear
content: Texas quarterback Arch Manning says his playing future -- whether it's remaining with the Longhorns after this season or entering the NFL draft -- has yet to be decided despite recent comments by his grandfather Archie Manning.

title: Royals' Witt joins elite company with 100th HR
content: Royals shortstop Bobby Witt Jr. hit his 100th career home run Tuesday, becoming the youngest player in franchise history to reach that mark.

title: Robles suspended 10 games, fined for bat heave
content: Victor Robles has received a 10-game suspension and an undisclosed fine for throwing his bat at a Triple-A pitcher Sunday.

title: Chávez deported to Mexico for alleged cartel ties
content: Julio César Chávez Jr., 39, arrested days after his fight with Jake Paul, has been deported to Mexico, where he's wanted for alleged cartel ties, following his detention in the U.S. for allegedly overstaying his visa and lying on a green card application.

title: Rory: Took home 1,100 Masters flags after win
content: Rory McIlroy said he took all 1,100 pin flags from the Masters Shop after winning at Augusta National in April. "I've waited 17 years to sign that flag in the middle, and I will never complain about doing it."

title: 👀 Indiana's mascot resurrected after 50 years!
content: Indiana's original bison mascot was described as "the devil with a cheerleader in it" -- but now a new version has risen from the ashes thanks to a passionate professor, underground student government action, a campus bar and more.

title: Are the Colts, Anthony Richardson headed for a breakup? Is there a trade market? What's next?
content: Naming Daniel Jones the starter might have irrevocably damaged the relationship between the Colts and Richardson? Here's what to know.

title: Meet the Bama-beating, NCAA-suing QB ready to take Vanderbilt to the next level
content: Never one to back down, Diego Pavia has made a name for himself in Nashville -- and he's not done yet.

title: Cam Ward, Brian Callahan and the Tennessee Titans' historically worrying challenge
content: The past two No. 1 picks have seen their coaches fired in November. How will Cam Ward (and Brian Callahan) avoid the same fate?

title: What to believe -- and not to believe in the National League
content: Milwaukee is on fire. New York is ice cold. Top players are hurt or struggling. Here's what it all means.

title: What makes Tarik Skubal and Paul Skenes the best pitchers on the planet
content: Here's what separates the Cy Young favorites from other aces, according to those who watch them most.

title: Pegula-Draper, Ruud-Swiatek reach US Open semi
content: Casper Ruud and Iga Swiatek will face the top-seeded duo of Jessica Pegula and Jack Draper in one semifinal of the revamped US Open mixed doubles tournament. Sara Errani and Andrea Vavassori meet Danielle Collins and Christian Harrison in the other.

title: NBA milestones: Landmarks to watch this season for LeBron, Jokic and others
content: Important milestones to watch ahead of the 2025-26 season, including another historic season from LeBron James and Nikola Jokic.

title: WNBA Power Rankings: Should the Dream be considered title contenders?
content: Atlanta will be pressure-tested against the league's best teams this week, starting with a red-hot Las Vegas.

title: 'We know how to weather storms': How the Aces saved their season
content: Las Vegas, .500 at the All-Star break, has won seven straight and is vying to host early WNBA playoff games.

title: Aging stars coming to MLS from Europe: How do you know when it'll be a hit or a bust?
content: From Lionel Messi to Son Heung-Min, how do MLS teams know when signing a close-to-retirement star from Europe is a good idea?

title: What early issues need solving for some top Premier League clubs?
content: The first matchday of the Premier League is over, so what did some of the top clubs learn from it? Arsenal need to fix their press, while Chelsea could play Cole Palmer out wide.

title: What Browns naming Joe Flacco QB1 means for Shedeur Sanders, Dillon Gabriel
content: The Browns have a Week 1 starter, but the clock to begin finding their long-term quarterback solution continues.

title: AFC East betting preview: Bills odds-on favorite to take division
content: Can anyone keep up with the Bills in the AFC East? Here are all the odds for each team in the division and our favorite bets.

title: Florida announces retro uniforms for homecoming game against Mississippi State
content: Last worn in 2021, the Gators' throwback threads offer a simplistic twist on the school's iconic blue and orange color scheme.

title: Jalen Brunson, Natalia Bryant star together in new Nike Kobe sneaker ad
content: A key feature of the new Nike Kobe 3 Protro is diamond shapes on the upper and outsole in honor of Natalia.

title: Answering the biggest questions facing Keegan Bradley with six U.S. Ryder Cup spots left
content: Will Bradley choose himself to play at ? Who are locks to make the team? We answer some of the biggest questions with six captain's picks left to fill out the team.

title: 'You felt the momentum change': Michael Vick's early impact at Norfolk State
content: Vick is coaching just 30 miles from where he grew up, and in the state where he electrified college football as a player.

title: Solak: Everything I learned at 10 different NFL training camp stops
content: After visits with 10 NFL teams in eight states, Ben Solak compiled the best things he heard -- and saw -- throughout the trip.

title: NWSL Power Rankings: San Diego becomes KC's closest challenger
content: Kansas City is all alone out front, but the fight for second? That's headed by San Diego in ESPN's latest NWSL Power Rankings.

title: How will Xabi Alonso handle LaLiga refereeing at Real Madrid?
content: As Real Madrid's new manager, Alonso will soon be exposed to the eccentricities of refereeing in LaLiga.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool ready £130m move for Isak
content: Liverpool have sanctioned a £130m move to land Newcastle United striker Alexander Isak. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Moses Itauma makes massive impression at heavyweight
content: Itauma's quick finish of Dillian Whyte on Saturday elevates him in top 10. Here are the latest ESPN rankings in all weight classes.

title: Unjustified, says Russia on U.S. pressure on India for buying Russian crude oil
content: ‘We are confident that India-Russia energy cooperation will continue notwithstanding the external pressure,’ said the Russian diplomat

title: Telangana Govt notifies allotment of 2,620 retail liquor outlets for 2025-27; ₹5 lakh per annum for walk-in stores
content: Applications called for 2,620 A4 outlets, Govt to raise substantial amount through non refundable fee

title: Assam cab unions threaten stir after CM Himanta’s ‘stranger’ barb
content: Three associations of cabbies took offence to Himanta Biswa Sarma associating ride-share services with “unknown elements”

title: 10-ft-long Indian Rock Python rescued from residential society in Mumbai
content: Indian Rock Python, displaced due to heavy rains and exhausted, was rescued in Mumbai’s Mulund area after straying into residential premises, causing panic among residents

title: Delhi CM Rekha Gupta attacked: AAP, Congress condemn the attack, raise concerns over women’s safety
content: Political leaders denounced the attack on Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta during a public event, highlighting concerns about women’s safety in the national capital

title: PM Modi to visit Gayaji to launch projects, address rally on August 22 ahead of Bihar Assembly polls
content: Bihar Deputy Chief Minister said PM Modi would inaugurate and lay the foundation stone for State’s first six-lane bridge over the Ganga river and development projects worth approximately ₹1,200 crore

title: NIA conducts searches at house of alleged member of banned PFI in Tenkasi
content: The searches were in connection with the 2019 murder of Ramalingam, a Pattali Makkal Katchi (PMK) functionary

title: Gaurav Gogoi slams police summons to journalists Siddharth Varadarajan, Karan Thapar
content: Reacting to Assam Police’s summons to the senior journalists on sedition charges, Congress leader Gaurav Gogoi said this was not the ‘Assam way’.

title: India won’t take first step to normalise ties, onus on Pakistan: Shashi Tharoor
content: The senior Congress leader urges Pakistan to dismantle terror networks operating from its soil and said India would be more than willing to reciprocate once such action is taken

title: Varanasi court orders FIR against Bhojpuri actor Pawan Singh, three others
content: The order was passed on August 13, 2025 by the court of the Additional Chief Judicial Magistrate-II after hearing an application filed by businessman Vishal Singh

title: Chennai hospital treats IT professional with rare skin cancer
content: The cancer had severely affected the patient’s scalp and skull; doctors at the hospital removed the tumour and then re-constructed the skull

title: Rajinikanth-starrer Coolie producers accepted ‘A’ certificate after refusing to make further cuts, CBFC tells Madras High Court
content: Appearing before Justice T.V. Thamilselvi, Additional Solicitor General AR.L. Sundaresan says, Sun TV Network Limited had made an endorsement stating that it does not want any more cuts

title: Tribal groups to take out candlelight march in Ranchi over wanted man's 'encounter' death
content: Hansda was arrested from Nawadih village in Deoghar on August 10, and the alleged encounter took place when he was being taken to Rahadbadia Hills to recover hidden weapons

title: Mumbai rains: Extreme rainfall intensified by climate change and multiple weather systems, warn scientists, climate experts
content: Meteorologists have attributed the intense downpour to the alignment of multiple weather systems and stress on the need for early warning systems and adaptation strategies

title: GESCOM consumers save ₹2,327.42 crore in two years under Gruha Jyothi scheme of Karnataka government
content: Launched on August 1, 2023, with registrations starting from June 18, 2023, the Gruha Jyothi scheme provided free electricity up to 200 units per month to eligible consumers

title: Supreme Court dismisses West Bengal’s review plea against cancellation of nearly 24,000 school appointments
content: The Court refused to entertain the West Bengal government’s review pleas, noting that all relevant issues had already been comprehensively addressed

title: Meghalaya organisation takes Garoland statehood plea to Delhi
content: The Garoland State Movement Committee also sought 43 months’ unpaid salaries for employees of the Garo Hills Autonomous District Council

title: Shortage of cardiothoracic surgeons ails government hospitals in T.N.
content: Patients are having to wait for two to three months for cardiac surgeries; lack of equipment at hospitals is also hampering services, say doctors

title: 14 questions raised by President Murmu in Presidential Reference
content: A five-judge Constitution Bench of the Supreme Court began hearing the Presidential Reference on these questions on the power to assent on Bills.

title: Chhattisgarh Cabinet expanded; three new faces take oath as Ministers
content: At a ceremony hosted at the Raj Bhawan, Governor Ramen Deka administered the oath of office and secrecy to BJP legislators Rajesh Agrawal, Guru Khushwant Saheb and Gajendra Yadav

title: Madras High Court refuses to quash Greater Chennai Corporation resolutions for outsourcing conservancy work
content: Justice K. Surender, however, directs the civic body to hold negotiations with the private employer and ensure that the absorbed workers get the last-drawn wages or more

title: Arvind Kejriwal's arrest in 2024 strengthened AAP's resolve to take on BJP: Atishi
content: "When Arvind Kejriwal ji was arrested, I remember thinking this — whatever may happen now, we will fight against the BJP till our last breath," Atishi said when asked if after Arvind Kejriwal's arrest she thought it was all over

title: Supreme Court flips Centre’s reference to Constituent Assembly debates on time limit for President to decide on Bills
content: The Solicitor General detailed that Dr. B.R. Ambedkar had intervened that day to substitute the term “six weeks” with the phrase “as soon as possible” in the proviso of draft Article 91; the CJI viewed the debate from a different angle, pointed out that a time limit was indeed contemplated by Constituent Assembly members

title: C.P. Radhakrishnan files nomination as NDA’s vice-presidential candidate
content: Mr. Radhakrishnan, whose election is a certainty, was accompanied by PM Modi and other Union Ministers

title: Presidential Reference hearing LIVE | Governor’s office will be reduced to a postman without discretionary powers: Centre
content: Earlier in the hearing, the Solicitor General said that the President and Governors are representations of democratic will

title: Parliament Monsoon session Day 20 LIVE: Ruckus in Lok Sabha as Opposition members throw paper bits at Amit Shah; House adjourns till 3 p.m.
content: Home Minister Amit Shah introduced three Bills in the Lok Sabha to provide legal framework for removal of the Prime Minister, Union Ministers, Chief Ministers and Ministers in States and Union Territories who are “arrested and detained in custody on account of serious criminal charges”

title: Missing Madhya Pradesh lawyer found in U.P.’s town on Nepal border after 12 days
content: According to police, the last location of the 29-year-old lawyer, Archana Tiwari, was traced to Itarsi station and after that, her mobile phone was found switched off

title: T.N. CM Stalin condemns action by Assam Police against journalists Siddharth Varadarajan, Karan Thapar of The Wire
content: Section 152 of the BNS is being misused as a substitute for the repealed sedition law to suppress independent journalism, said Stalin

title: Karnataka rain: 75-year-old dies after roof collapses on him in Ramadurg
content: Vaman Rao Bapu Pawar, 75, was asleep in his house near the Mahadev temple in Ningapur Pet when the roof collapsed following overnight rains

title: Delhi CM Rekha Gupta assaulted during ‘Jan Sunwai’ programme, suspect arrested
content: The accused man first handed over a paper as a complaint to Rekha Gupta and then allegedly attacked her. The Chief Minister reportedly suffered a ‘light blow to the head’

title: Gujarat’s coastal districts likely to receive very heavy rains; NDRF, SDRF deployed
content: The India Meteorological Department has also issued a forecast of moderate to heavy rains across most parts of Gujarat till August 25

title: Astronomy Olympiad, held in Mumbai this year, suspends Israel from future editions
content: The decision to suspend its official status followed calls from members of the international scientific community to take action over Israel’s activities in Palestine

title: Widespread broadband outage in Hyderabad as electricity department removes dangling cables of ISPs
content: The action has been triggered by a series of fatalities due to the hanging cables in Ramanthapur, Amberpet and Bandlaguda in a span of 24 hours

title: Mumbai rains LIVE: IMD issues orange alert; airlines announce travel advisory
content: Akasa Air and IndiGo airlines issue travel advisory for passengers amid heavy rain; Santacruz receives over 200 mm rain in 24 hours

title: Pregnant daughter pushed into Bangladesh, father wonders what will be nationality of the grandchild
content: Sonali Bibi and her husband Danish and their eight year old child are part of a group of six persons who were detained from Delhi, a few weeks ago and allegedly pushed into Bangladesh

title: Assam study finds cobra, krait can inject venom after death
content: Such envenoming has largely been reported in the cases of rattlesnakes, copperheads, spitting cobras, and the Australian red-bellied black snakes

title: Bihar Cabinet approves two five-star hotels; 16 other decisions given approval
content: State Teacher Award amount doubled from ₹15,000 to ₹30,000. It also reduced the fee to ₹100 for Preliminary Test (PT). List of holidays for calendar year 2026 also approved

title: An ode to Madras, in 1939
content: The Chennai Kanchi while speaking of the glories of Madras, also warns the then ruling dispensation of the evanescence of rule, empire and domination

title: 'If Indian goods can't go to US, they can ...': Russia slams Trump tariffs; calls pressure over oil 'unjustified'
content: Prime Minister Modi and Russian President Putin are scheduled to meet in New Delhi to bolster trade ties, focusing on improved payment systems and the removal of trade barriers. Russia aims to strengthen its economic partnership with India amidst global challenges.

title: Upset over SC order on stray dogs? Man who 'attacked' Delhi CM did 'recce'; how incident unfolded
content: Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta was allegedly attacked during her Jan Sunwai, causing chaos. A man, identified as Rajesh Bhai Khimji Bhai Sakriya, reportedly grabbed her hand, prompting immediate intervention by attendees and security. Virendra Sachdeva, Delhi BJP president, called it a security breach. Gupta, though in shock, is stable and committed to her work.

title: 'Bill to remove PM, CMs': Tharoor breaks from party line; calls proposal 'reasonable'
content: Shashi Tharoor supports the new bills regarding ministers' removal upon imprisonment. The bills propose removing ministers jailed for 30 days on serious charges. This stance differs from other Congress leaders like Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, who criticizes the bill. She calls it draconian and anti-democratic. The proposed law mandates resignation for PMs, CMs, and ministers detained for offenses with five-year sentences.

title: Foxconn shift: No longer Apple’s iPhone factory floor; now building this AI technology
content: Foxconn, known for iPhone production, is changing its business. The company is now focusing on artificial intelligence. It is building AI servers for cloud computing and generative AI. Demand for AI infrastructure is increasing. Foxconn is partnering with Nvidia, Supermicro, and Dell. This move positions Foxconn as a key player in enterprise hardware.

title: Asia Cup: How six-hitting changed T20 cricket; India’s surge in the big-hit race
content: T20 cricket has undergone a six-hitting revolution, transforming batting from risk-averse accumulation to power-driven aggression. India, once lagging behind, now match the world’s best with a six every 12 balls in 2024. With IPL and internationals fuelling the trend, six-hitting is now the currency of modern T20 cricket.

title: Protest at Ahmedabad school: Class 10 student stabbed to death by junior; building ransacked
content: A Class 8 student in Ahmedabad tragically died after being stabbed during a fight with a Class 10 student at Seventh-Day Adventist School. The incident ignited protests by the victim's family, the Sindhi community, and other parents, who gathered at the school demanding action.

title: Florida crash: Harjinder Singh, who killed 3, fails English, road tests
content: Harjinder Singh, an Indian immigrant trucker, faces charges for a fatal Florida crash after a reckless U-turn. Despite failing English and road sign tests, he obtained commercial driver's licenses in California and Washington. The incident has ignited a political clash between the Trump administration and California Governor Gavin Newsom over immigration and licensing policies, highlighting concerns about public safety.

title: Apple's Big India move: All iPhone 17 models Made in India for US; Trump could be reason why
content: Apple is set to manufacture all iPhone 17 models in India before their September launch, a first for the company, including the Pro versions. This shift, driven by tariff concerns and geopolitical tensions, aims to fulfill most US iPhone demand from India. The Tata Group will handle half of India's iPhone production, with exports already reaching $7.

title: ‘Lucky charm’: How a Ukrainian designer styled Zelenskyy for Trump meeting
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy met with US President Donald Trump in a military-style attire designed by Viktor Anisimov, a subtle shift from his usual wartime look. Anisimov aimed to incorporate civilian elements, hoping it would serve as a 'lucky charm' for peace. Trump praised Zelenskyy's outfit, a contrast to a previous tense meeting.

title: Asia Cup: New fave in Indian cricket? Gill's elevation a natural progression
content: Shubman Gill's selection as T20 vice-captain for the Asia Cup reflects his consistent IPL performance and leadership qualities, solidifying his place in the squad. His elevation signals a strategic move by the BCCI, potentially positioning him as a future all-format captain and a key figure in Indian cricket's brand identity.

title: NCERT launches modules on Op Sindoor for class 3 to 12: What’s in store for students
content: NCERT has introduced Operation Sindoor modules for classes 3-12, embedding lessons of courage and national pride into the curriculum. These modules detail the mission launched in response to the Pahalgam terror attack, showcasing India's military capabilities and the unity displayed across the nation. It highlights technological advancements and diplomatic achievements, emphasizing the importance of standing against terrorism.

title: ‘Rockets to Wall Street’: Musk’s teen prodigy leaves SpaceX; joins Citadel Securities
content: Kairan Quazi, the 16-year-old prodigy who previously worked at SpaceX, is now joining Citadel Securities as a developer in New York City. He chose the quantitative trading firm over AI labs and big tech companies, drawn to the fast-paced environment and intellectual challenges. Quazi will be working on global trading infrastructure, embracing Wall Street's meritocratic culture.

title: Drug overdose? Medical PG student found dead in hostel room; was undergoing treatment for depression
content: Dr. Priya Karthika, a 27-year-old psychiatry PG student at Belagavi Institute of Medical Sciences (BIMS), tragically died by suicide on Monday. She allegedly consumed an overdose of medicine in her hostel room after completing her hospital duty. Dr. Karthika had a history of depression and had previously attempted suicide, receiving treatment in Bengaluru.

title: August rain fury: Mumbai reels under record showers; flights, local trains impacted
content: Mumbai grappled with severe disruptions due to relentless rainfall, triggering a red alert. The city experienced its wettest August in five years, surpassing average rainfall. Waterlogging, traffic chaos, and power outages plagued the region. Transportation networks faced major suspensions, with bus routes diverted and train services halted.

title: Delhi: Over 50 schools receive fresh bomb threats; ‘Terrorizers 111’ group demands $25k
content: Over 50 schools in Delhi received bomb threat emails from 'Terrorizers 111', demanding USD 25,000 after a similar incident in August. The group claimed to have planted explosives and breached IT systems, threatening detonation if demands weren't met. Authorities are taking the threats seriously, evacuating schools and conducting thorough searches, despite previous threats being hoaxes.

title: Sophie Cunningham sparks laughter on podcast: Calls Gisele Bündchen ‘Gazelle’
content: Sophie Cunningham, a WNBA player, faced backlash for making a joke about Gisele Bündchen on her podcast while discussing Tom Brady's statue. The comments came amid reports that Bündchen was upset with Brady's remarks about how his career influenced his parenting. The joke reignited public interest in their post-divorce relationship.

title: French streamer Jean Pormanove dies at 46, fans outraged
content: French streamer Jean Pormanove, known for his extreme IRL broadcasts, tragically died at 46, sparking grief and outrage. His death followed a grueling Kick marathon, raising concerns about unsafe streaming culture. Fans are sharing disturbing clips, igniting debate on platform accountability and creator safety in the face of toxic content.

title: Asia Cup hockey: 'Security in India better', says official on Pak's withdrawal
content: Pakistan and Oman have withdrawn from the Hockey Asia Cup 2025 in India, citing security concerns, a claim dismissed by Indian officials. The tournament, crucial for 2026 World Cup qualification, will proceed with eight teams. India's hockey officials emphasize that security arrangements are robust and are focused on hosting a successful event despite the withdrawals.

title: Virat Kohli kissing Anushka Sharma's forehead at wedding was photographer's fav pic
content: Joseph Radhik, the photographer behind Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma's dreamy Tuscany wedding, reminisces about the experience. He highlights the couple's request for authentic, unretouched images and the overwhelming reach of his work, even to unexpected corners of India. While unfazed by Virat, Radhik admits being star-struck photographing Priyanka Chopra's wedding to Nick Jonas.

title: 'Please move on': Dhanashree Verma on ex-Yuzvendra's ‘fake marriage’ remark
content: Dhanashree Verma addressed Yuzvendra Chahal's remarks regarding their marriage. She cautioned against exploiting her silence. Dhanashree spoke about the social media criticism she faced post-divorce. She expressed optimism about her career and future prospects. Dhanashree hopes to find love again. She emphasized the importance of self-love while remaining open to new relationships.

title: Indians on H-1B: Where will they go if they lose jobs in the US?
content: For Indian professionals on H-1B and L-1 visas, the American dream is increasingly uncertain. Visa restrictions, sudden policy shifts, and political rhetoric are reshaping career and life choices. A Blind poll shows 45% would return to India if laid off, drawn by family, cultural ties, and tech opportunities, while regulatory changes and professional risks continue to complicate long-term planning.

title: 'I gotta see it': Patrick Mahomes recalls reaction to Travis Kelce, Taylor Swift relationship
content: Patrick Mahomes initially doubted Travis Kelce's relationship with Taylor Swift, needing to witness it to believe it. He acknowledged the increased buzz and attention Swift brought to the stadium. Mahomes also praised Swift's dedication to her new album, revealed on Kelce's podcast, as both athletes focus on their comeback after a Super Bowl loss.

title: Sexual violence against women: India calls out Pak’s 'hypocrisy' at UN
content: At a UN Security Council debate, India's representative Eldos Mathew Punnoos accused Pakistan of historical and ongoing sexual violence, particularly against minority women, dating back to the 1971 conflict.

title: 'Game must go on': Wasim Akram gives opinion on India vs Pak match in Asia Cup
content: Pakistani cricket legend Wasim Akram emphasizes that the Asia Cup 2025 should proceed regardless of India's participation against Pakistan. Scheduled in Dubai and Abu Dhabi from September 9-28, the tournament features eight teams. Akram voices optimism for a future India-Pakistan Test series, advocating for focusing on sporting achievements and avoiding political tensions.

title: Who is Kairan Quazi? 16-year-old teen engineer leaving Elon Musk’s SpaceX - Why?
content: Kairan Quazi, the 16-year-old prodigy, is transitioning from SpaceX's Starlink project to Citadel Securities as a quant developer. After graduating from Santa Clara University at 14, he defied age barriers at SpaceX. Now, he's set to apply his unique engineering and problem-solving skills to quantitative finance, overcoming challenges related to age-based biases in the professional world.

title: 'Successful strikes, not Mr Trump': Tharoor rebuts US President's mediation claim
content: Shashi Tharoor stated that Pakistan must dismantle terror networks before India considers repairing ties. He highlighted past attempts at outreach betrayed by Pakistani hostility. Tharoor recalled the 2008 Mumbai attacks and India's evidence of Pakistani involvement. He mentioned India's restraint giving way to surgical strikes. Tharoor cited France, Germany, US and Vietnam as examples of reconciliation.

title: Did Trump impose 'sanctions on India' to pressure Moscow? What White House said
content: Donald Trump increased tariffs on Indian goods. The White House stated this was to pressure Russia to end the Ukraine conflict. This followed meetings between Trump and Volodymyr Zelenskyy. Trump aims for trilateral talks with Vladimir Putin. India is concerned about replacing Russian oil imports. European leaders are reportedly grateful for Trump's insights into Russia's position.

title: Gold price prediction: Where is the rate headed in the near-term?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are fluctuating within a range as strong US PPI data tempers expectations of aggressive Federal Reserve rate cuts. Indian gold demand saw a slight uptick due to price pullbacks ahead of the festive season. Investors are awaiting insights from Fed Chair Powell's speech at the Jackson Hole symposium for cues on future rate adjustments.

title: 'Shreyas Iyer not liked as much as ... ': Ex-India coach blasts Gambhir & Agarkar
content: Shreyas Iyer's exclusion from both the Asia Cup squad and standby list has sparked controversy, despite his impressive IPL 2025 performance. Former assistant coach Abhishek Nayar questioned the decision, emphasizing Iyer's strong contention. Chief selector Ajit Agarkar acknowledged the difficulty of the decision, citing limited squad space.

title: ‘No place for violence’: AAP’s Atishi condemns attack on Delhi CM Rekha Gupta
content: Delhi's political landscape is stirred as leaders across party lines condemn the attack on Chief Minister Rekha Gupta during a Jan Sunvai event. Atishi, Leader of Opposition, emphasized the absence of violence in democracy, urging strict action. BJP President Virendra Sachdeva also denounced the incident, while Congress chief Devender Yadav questioned the CM's security, highlighting broader safety concerns.

title: 'Allow extra time for commute': Indigo issues advisory amid heavy rains in Mumbai
content: IndiGo issued a travel advisory due to expected heavy rain in Mumbai, potentially causing air traffic congestion and flight disruptions. Passengers are advised to check flight status and allow extra commute time. Mumbai has been experiencing intense rainfall, with the IMD issuing alerts and recording significant amounts of rain, leading to diversions and delays.

title: Stock market: Nifty50 opens in red; BSE Sensex down over 100 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in red after a few days of strong rally. While Nifty50 went below 24,950, BSE Sensex was down over 100 points.

title: Govt's big move: HM Shah to table bills for PM, CMs removal for arrests on serious charges
content: Home Minister Amit Shah is set to introduce three bills mandating the resignation or removal of the Prime Minister, Chief Ministers, and ministers if they are detained for 30 consecutive days on allegations of offenses punishable by five or more years in prison.

title: 'Most beautiful bride': Celeste Desjardins reacts to Foegele & Servos' wedding
content: Warren Foegele and Alexandra Servos celebrated their marriage at Toronto's Fairmont Royal York, surrounded by friends and family. The couple then attended Leon Draisaitl and Celeste Desjardins’ wedding at a French château, joining a gathering of NHL stars and their partners. Both weddings showcased romance, friendship, and the strong bonds within the NHL community, creating unforgettable moments.

title: 'Imran Khan wasn't talented, used to shout at us': Wasim Akram
content: Wasim Akram lauded Imran Khan as the greatest captain he played under, highlighting Khan's pivotal role in shaping his career. Akram emphasized that Khan's success stemmed from relentless hard work and determination, exemplified by his willingness to reinvent his bowling action. Imran's leadership instilled confidence in the team, demanding full commitment and intolerance for complacency on the field.

title: Slammed! 'Axar Patel deserves an explanation for removal from vice-captaincy'
content: Mohammad Kaif has voiced concerns over Axar Patel's removal as T20I vice-captain, replaced by Shubman Gill after a year's absence. Kaif emphasized that Patel deserved prior notification and an explanation for the decision, especially considering his crucial role in India's T20 World Cup 2024 victory. Patel's consistent all-round performance includes 531 runs and 71 wickets in 71 matches.

title: 'Likes sports, but doesn't play games in politics': PM on NDA VP nominee CP Radhakrishnan
content: PM Modi endorsed NDA's vice-presidential candidate, CP Radhakrishnan, highlighting their long friendship and Radhakrishnan's dedication to public service. Modi urged opposition support, praising Radhakrishnan's integrity. The PM also celebrated India's improved credit rating and economic outlook, noting positive market response to recent reforms.

title: Bill Belichick, Jordon Hudson ‘in love’: Romance faces tension with ex Linda Holliday
content: Bill Belichick and Jordon Hudson are “madly in love” and sending Linda Holliday a blunt message to “get over it” after their latest Nantucket encounter. With Belichick locked in on UNC’s Sept. 1 season opener, the drama with his longtime ex lingers off the field.

title: Real-money gaming ban a death knell for us: Industry
content: India's gaming industry faces a potential crisis as the government considers banning "online money games." Experts warn this could devastate the sector, jeopardizing 4 lakh companies, 2 lakh jobs, and significant investments and GST revenue. Gaming executives express concerns about winding down operations due to the lack of consultation and potential impact on domestic sports.

title: Afghanistan bus accident: 76 killed after vehicle collides with truck, motorcycle
content: A tragic accident in western Afghanistan claimed 76 lives. A bus carrying refugees collided with a truck and motorcycle, resulting in a fire. Among the deceased were 17 children. The bus was transporting Afghan refugees recently deported from Iran. Authorities attribute the accident to excessive speed and negligence. The refugees had boarded the bus at the Islam Qala border crossing.

title: 'Will give view on Prez reference; won’t decide validity of TN guv verdict': SC
content: The Supreme Court is set to offer its opinion on the President's queries regarding the power to set timelines for governors and the President in assenting to bills. Despite objections from Tamil Nadu and Kerala, the court indicated it would proceed if significant legal questions are involved.

title: 'Coolie' BO day 6: Rajinikanth's film touches Rs 216 crore mark
content: Rajinikanth's 'Coolie,' directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, had a strong opening during the Independence Day weekend, crossing Rs 200 crore in India. However, weekday collections have dipped amidst competition from 'War 2,' starring Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR. Despite the slowdown, 'Coolie' has surpassed Rs 400 crore worldwide, showcasing Rajinikanth's continued box office power.

title: ‘It was painful’: Dhanashree Verma breaks silence on divorce
content: Dhanashree Verma has addressed her divorce from Yuzvendra Chahal, expressing her sadness and criticising his choice of attire at the hearing. Chahal's t-shirt, bearing the words “Be your own sugar daddy”, sparked controversy and social media backlash. Dhanashree revealed her emotional breakdown during the verdict and how the incident ultimately motivated her to move on.

title: Video: Day Before Assault, Rekha Gupta Attacker Visited Her Ancestral House
content: The accused behind the attack on Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta had recced her ancestral residence in Shalimar Bagh area on Tuesday, CCTV footage showed on Wednesday.

title: Chaos In House As Amit Shah Introduces Bill On Removal Of PM, Chief Ministers
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah has introduced a controversial law in Lok Sabha under which the Prime Minister and Chief Ministers of states can be removed from office if they are in jail for 30 days, even if they are not convicted of the crime.

title: "If India Refuses Russian Oil...": What Moscow Official Said On Trump Tariff
content: India is welcome to export its products to Russia if it is facing trouble entering the US market, a senior Russian diplomat said on Wednesday.

title: Lucknow Lawyer Gets Life Sentence For Filing Fake Cases By Misusing Dalit Woman's Identity
content: A special court here has sentenced an advocate to life imprisonment and imposed a fine of Rs 5.10 lakh after finding him guilty of misusing the identity of a Dalit woman to file dozens of fake cases against his opponents .

title: Parliament Monsoon Session Live Updates: Amit Shah Introduces Bills On Removal Of PM, J&K Reorganisation
content: The Government of Union Territories (Amendment) Bill 2025, the Constitution (One Hundred And Thirtieth Amendment) Bill 2025, and the Jammu and Kashmir Reorganisation (Amendment) Bill 2025 could be moved to a parliamentary committee.

title: "No Personal Attack, Veep Polls Decent Contest": Opposition Nominee To NDTV
content: A narrative is being set that the Vice-Presidential election has pitted Telangana against Tamil Nadu, said the Opposition's nominee and retired Supreme Court judge Justice B Sudershan Reddy.

title: Class 10 Student Stabbed To Death By Junior, Massive Protests In Gujarat
content: A class 10 student from Ahmedabad died of his injuries a day after he was stabbed by a junior following an altercation. The news of the death has sparked intense anger among parents and the local community, leading to protests outside the school.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Planes, Films With Bachchans, Lucknow: Growing Up As Rajiv Gandhi
content: By September 1944, Nehru wrote to sister Vijay Lakshmi Pandit that if the family did not decide soon, "we shall have to call [him]...the Nameless or the one with innumerable names". Nehru chose the name 'Rajiv' because it meant lotus in Sanskrit.

title: Himachal Pradesh Monsoon Leaves 276 Dead, 336 Injured, 37 Missing So Far
content: The monsoon's fury in Himachal Pradesh has left 276 people dead since June 20, with 143 fatalities caused by rain-related incidents such as landslides, flash floods, cloudbursts, drowning, electrocution, and falls from steep slopes.

title: 10-Foot-Long Rock Python Rescued From Housing Society In Mumbai
content: A 10-foot-long Indian Rock Python strayed into a residential premises in Mumbai's Mulund area, causing panic among people, a wildlife welfare organisation said.

title: Man Who Attacked Delhi Chief Minister A Dog Lover, Was Upset, Claims Mother
content: The man who attacked Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta has been identified as Rajesh Sakaria, originally from Rajkot in Gujarat

title: Death Count In Pakistan's Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Floods Rises To 365, Rescue Efforts Underway
content: The death toll in the flood-ravaged province of Pakistan's Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (KP) has surged to 365, as torrential rains and flash floods continue to batter the region, with new casualties and destruction reported across several districts.

title: Centre Makes Raw Cotton Import Duty-Free Till September 30 To Support Textile Sector
content: The Centre has temporarily scrapped the 11% duty on raw cotton imports until September 30, seeking to cool prices and ease cost pressures on the textile industry at a time when exporters face mounting tariff barriers abroad.

title: Trinamool Leader Sues RG Kar Rape-Murder Victim's Father For Defamation
content: A senior Trinamool Congress leader has filed a defamation case against the father of the 34-year-old doctor, who was raped and murdered at Kolkata's RG Kar Medical College and Hospital last year

title: Australia Chides Israel After Diplomats' Visas Revoked
content: Australia's foreign minister criticised Israel for revoking visas held by Canberra's diplomatic representatives to the Palestinian Authority.

title: Video: Rahul Gandhi's "Uncommon Handshake" With BJP MP After Club Poll Win
content: Senior Congress leader Rahul Gandhi today congratulated BJP MP and former Union Minister Rajiv Pratap Rudy on winning the election for a key post in the Constitution Club of India, describing it as an "uncommon handshake".

title: 30-Year-Old Suspected Of Spying For Pakistan Arrested, Fourth Case In Jaisalmer
content: A 30-year-old man suspected of spying for Pakistan was detained by the Military Intelligence (MI) in Rajasthan's Jaisalmer and later handed over to Kotwali police, officials said on Wednesday.

title: Two earthquakes of magnitude 3.3 and 4.0 jolt Himachal Pradesh’s Chamba
content: The first earthquake of magnitude 3.3 struck Chamba at 3:27 a.m.; second quake of magnitude 4.0 rocked the same region at 4:39 a.m.

title: When the Madras Presidency was spread across 1,59,798 square miles
content: The vast Presidency, back then, comprised just 21 districts. Of them, three lay within the influence of the never-failing rains of the southwest monsoon

title: When DMK opposed a Vice-President candidate from Tamil Nadu 41 years ago
content: On August 1, 1984, the Congress (I) Parliamentary board formally nominated R. Venkataraman, who was serving as Defence Minister in Prime Minister Indira Gandhi’s Cabinet, for the office of Vice-President of India

title: Will hold dharna if West Bengal’s college admissions do not begin soon, warns BJP
content: Opposition parties in West Bengal step up heat on the government in the wake of an unprecedented delay in WBJEE results and indefinite suspension of MBBS, BDS admissions

title: Manipur HC orders State to issue academic certificates with changed name, gender to transwoman
content: Beoncy Laishram, born male, had challenged the education authorities’ refusal to make changes in her certificates

title: Saltwater crocodiles thriving in Sundarbans; 213 direct sightings in 2025
content: The West Bengal government has, in the last many decades, made significant efforts to conserve saltwater crocodiles, with a conservation and breeding facility in the form of the Bhagabatpur Crocodile Project

title: ISRO accelerating country’s space ambitions, says its chief
content: ‘We are also in the advanced development stages of Gaganyaan and its first unmanned mission is planned very shortly’

title: Electrocution deaths in Hyderabad processions: Towering idols and dangling wires make for a fatal mix
content: Despite court orders and repeated warnings, dangerous wires and unchecked idol heights remain a deadly risk during festivals

title: W.B. Governor suggests MoUs with other States to address issues of migrant workers
content: Ensuring enforcement of minimum wages, adherence to workplace safety standards, expedited mechanisms for grievance handling among steps Bose recommends to Central and State govts.

title: Assam job panel to drop controversial question on Manipur crisis
content: The Meitei Heritage Society had objected to a “malicious” question in an examination conducted by the Assam Public Service Commission on August 8 to recruit agricultural development officers

title: Centre to introduce law to prohibit real money gaming firms, official says
content: The Promotion and Regulation of Online Gaming Bill, 2025 represents a significant shift in the Union government’s attitude towards the real money gaming industry

title: Will vehemently oppose SIR in Odisha, if Bihar approach adopted, says BJD
content: In meeting with ECI, the party reiterates its objections to the unexplained and unusual variances in the number of votes polled and counted and sudden increase in polling percentage after 5 PM during 2024 elections

title: Revive Kochi Metropolitan Transport Authority by November 1, says Kerala HC
content: Court directs CEO of KMTA to submit a proposal to the government about its infrastructure needs and also to ready an Urban Transport Fund

title: No Aadhaar, no access to welfare schemes: officials offer to help tribal families in Maharashtra
content: Authorities have assured enrolment of children in schools and creation of key documents such as Aadhaar Card, birth certificates and bank accounts.

title: A.P. exporters seek Centre’s intervention as U.S. tariffs hit seafood industry hard
content: SEAI seeks relief measures including soft loans up to 30% of working capital at interest rates below 5% and extension of export credit facilities for 240 days for all seafood exporters

title: First flood warning issued for Krishna at Prakasam Barrage in A.P., all gates lifted
content: Prakasam Barrage on the Krishna in NTR district and Sir Arthur Cotton Barrage on the Godavari in Rajamahendravaram reaches full capacity

title: Buying land by paying money is not a crime, Rabri Devi submits in court in response to land-for-jobs scam
content: “When money has been paid, at most, it can be alleged that land was bought at cheap rates....sales happen because the parties needed money for which it sells land,” her counsel says.

title: Palla calls VSP privatisation charges by Opposition ‘false propaganda’
content: Some harsh decisions are inevitable for the continuation of VSP as a PSU, and this includes the privatisation of some sections of the plant to improve productivity and reduce costs, he says

title: P4 initiative: Selection of ‘Margadarshis’ is done voluntarily, says A.P. CM
content: The ‘Margadarshis’ should not only extend financial support but also provide reassurance to the adopted Bangaru Kutumbalu, says Naidu

title: Amit Shah to move three bills for removal of PM, CMs, Ministers held on serious criminal charges
content: The Home Minister has written to the Lok Sabha office informing that The Constitution (130th Amendment) Bill, 2025, The Jammu and Kashmir Reorganisation (Amendment) Bill, 2025 and The Government of Union Territories (Amendment) Bill, 2025 be passed in the ongoing session

title: Nearly 800 rescued as two Mumbai monorails halt midway amid heavy rains, CM Fadnavis promises inquiry
content: Emergency response teams including MFB, Police, Monorail staff, and 108 ambulance services were mobilised at both sites

title: 55-year-old man dies in Chennai after neighbour’s pit bull mauls him; pet owner also injured
content: Residents alleged that they had already complained to the police a few months ago about the ferocious dog and had demanded shifting of the animal from the residential area

title: Justice Tiruvarur Muthuswami Iyer statue in Chennai: Remembering an icon of the Madras High Court
content: Justice Tiruvarur Muthuswami Iyer was the first Indian to be appointed as a judge of the Madras High Court in 1878

title: After CSDS psephologist deletes X post, BJP accuses Congress of making ‘baseless claims’ on voter fraud
content: CSDS professor Sanjay Kumar deletes post with erroneous data on Maharashtra voters; BJP claims that Congress leader Rahul Gandhi’s allegations were based on Mr. Kumar’s data, calling him a “puppet”

title: Karnataka Cabinet approves internal quota, slicing SC reservation into three categories
content: The decision comes just over a year after the Supreme Court allowed internal reservation to be provided among Scheduled Castes

title: Congress alleges ‘vote theft’ in 27 seats in 2023 Madhya Pradesh polls, claims 16 lakh voters added in 2 months
content: The Congress says 27 Assembly seats have been identified where the margin of victory was very narrow, but the number of newly added voters was far greater than this margin

title: Cotton import duty exemption a death warrant to farmers, says Samyukt Kisan Morcha
content: Union government maintains the decision is good for textile industries, will help stabilise cotton prices

title: Pollachi sexual assault case: survivors receive compensation ordered by trial court after three months
content: The trial court in its judgment on May 13 ordered a total compensation of ₹85 lakh to seven out of the eight survivors in the case

title: Cabinet panel on security clears project to procure 97 LCA Mark 1A fighter jets for IAF
content: A senior defence official terms the decision a major boost to government’s Make in India initiative; the aircraft will be manufactured by Hindustan Aeronautics Limited

title: One seat reserved for SCs or STs on the boards of cooperative societies, says Amit Shah
content: The government had incorporated similar provisions in model byelaws for primary agricultural credit societies, the Cooperation Minister informed the Lok Sabha in a written reply

title: Sudershan Reddy’s candidature strengthens our collective resolve to safeguard democracy, says Stalin
content: The Tamil Nadu Chief Minister says B. Sudershan Reddy, a jurist of integrity and independence and a champion of civil liberties and social justice, has upheld constitutional values throughout his career

title: NFC East betting preview: Can anyone overtake the Eagles?
content: no team has won the NFC East in back-to-back seasons since 2001-04 . the Dallas Cowboys are the third choice at +700, followed by the New York Giants . defending champions are -160 to do just that, with the Washington Commanders next in line at +225 .

title: The stat that could swing every team's 2025-26 season
content: the new national TV calendar is taking shape . the new season schedule was unveiled this past week . training camps open in just over a month . there are plenty of reasons for the Hawks optimism this season . click here for all the latest NBA news .

title: It’s finally time! Where is your team in our preseason Power Rankings?
content: the 2025 season is just around the corner, so it's time to reevaluate the outlooks for all 32 teams . our power panel of more than 30 writers and editors evaluate how NFL teams stack up against each other . check out how holdouts, breakouts and injuries have impacted our rankings .

title: The little-known FIFA rule that gives Alexander Isak all the leverage over Newcastle
content: shaka Hislop thinks Alexander Isak may never be welcomed back into the side . the striker has been holding out after his club turned down a £110 million transfer bid from Liverpool . he thinks they could determine his future if they have knowledge of Article 17 .

title: Preseason Power Rankings: What to expect from each top-25 team
content: in just four days, the college football season kicks off with a week 0 matchup between no. 22 Iowa State and no. 17 Kansas State in Dublin . a lot of change has occurred since January . three of the top five teams in our initial power rankings have new starting quarterbacks .

title: Everything to know about the revamped -- and controversial -- US Open mixed doubles
content: the mixed doubles draw gets underway in new york on tuesday . the tournament features star-studded pairings, record prize money and a healthy dose of controversy . this edition runs concurrently with the main draw and the championship match is held during the final weekend .

title: 'Dana White's Contender Series' Week 2: Four KOs, five contracts awarded
content: "Dana White's Contender Series" returns for season 9 on august 12 . american welterweight Ty Miller earned the first contract on the season . susurkaev knocked out murtaza Talha with a vicious kick to the liver .
